4 deaths reported across Rajasthan.description: JAIPUR/UDAIPUR/JODHPUR: As 13 out of 25 constituencies in Rajasthan went to polls on Monday, reports of death of people on election duty or those gone to cast their vote also trickled in from across the state. In Rajsamand, an elderly woman died immediately after casting her vote. Badami Bai (62) fell unconscious and died after exercising her franchise at the polling booth of Bhim block in Rajsamand district on Monday morning. In another incident in Jodhpur district, block level officer Shaitan Singh died on Saturday night after falling from the roof of government school in Setrawa where he was posted as a teacher. A resident of the same village, Singh had gone to sleep on the roof of the school on Saturday night after completing polling work. He was rushed to the hospital by other employees but died due to severe head injury and blood loss. Another officer on election duty, Suresh Chandra (45), deployed in Udaipur died on Monday afternoon after his health deteriorated suddenly. He was taken to the hospital but doctors were unable to revive him and said a heart attack may have caused Chandra’s sudden demise. Prem Meena met a tragic end while on his way to cast his vote in Rawatbhata. Meena was on his bike when he was mowed down by a car. His son was to get married on May 11. Local police are investigating the case. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Showers, dust storm guide mercury down a.description: JAIPUR: Mild showers, dust storm and hailstorm guided the mercury to take a dip across the state on Saturday. However, the Met office said that the spell will vanish and the temperatures are set to soar from Sunday onwards. Barmer was the hottest place in state where a maximum temperature of 40 degrees Celsius was recorded. Most of the places in eastern and western Rajasthan witnessed cooler mornings following overnight rainfall. Till 8.30am on Saturday, Bikaner had received 40mm rain and was followed by Sikar with 30mm rain. Many places witnessed rainfall varying from 20mm to 10mm. Thereafter, the rainfall activity vanished except for mild dust storms at some places. Jaipurites witnessed the coldest morning of summer so far as a minimum temperature of 22.4 degrees Celsius, 5 degrees below normal, was recorded. Also, the afternoon recorded the lowest maximum temperature of the season at 36.4 degrees Celsius. Dip in temperatures to this extent is very rare, especially in the month of May. “During May, the city’s maximum temperatures vary from 41-45 degrees Celsius. However, this year Jaipur witnessed maximum temperatures between 35.5-41 degrees Celsius in May,” said a Jaipur Met official. Barmer was followed by Jaisalmer with a maximum temperature of 39 degrees Celsius, Kota 38.9, Bikaner 37.4, Udaipur 36.8, Ajmer 36.4, Jodhpur 36, Sriganganagar 35.7 and Churu recorded 35.5 degrees Celsius. Meanwhile, dust storms continued in Ajmer and Bhilwara on Saturday. Jaipur Met office said western disturbances and upper air cyclonic circulation have vanished which will push mercury up from Sunday onwards. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan to hire over 250 medical teach.description: JAIPUR: Medical education department will soon start recruitment of 269 faculty members for its medical colleges along with the recruitment of paramedical staff for 428 posts and 746 nursing posts. A high-level meeting was held under health minister Raghu Sharma in the city on Monday. Apart from filling vacant posts of teaching staff in medical colleges, the medical education department is all set to boost research in state colleges. For the purpose, multi-disciplinary research units (MDRU) have already been established in Jaipur, Jodhpur, Bikaner and Udaipur, said Sharma. He said that such MDRU will also come up in government medical colleges of Kota, Ajmer and Rajasthan University of Health Sciences. Besides, proposals have also been sent for establishing MDRUs in new medical colleges of the state in Pali, Dungarpur, Bharatpur, Bhilwara and Churu. The number of post-graduation seats in medical colleges have also been increased in the state. “We have received approval to increase 46 PG seats in medical colleges of Jodhpur and Jaipur. Besides, for increasing PG seats in other government medical colleges, proposals will be sent to the Centre,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Showers bring minor relief in Rajasthan.description: JAIPUR: After a prolonged spell of the heatwave conditions, minor relief was witnessed as a dip of almost 3 degree Celsius was witnessed in the state on Wednesday afternoon. It was though expected that cyclone Vayu was responsible for the widespread rainfall activity in Rajasthan, Jaipur Met office clearly refuted it saying “locally prevailed system responsible for it”. The dip in the temperatures was not enough to be called as a respite as majority of the places witnessed its maximum temperatures of 40 degree Celsius and above except Udaipur where a maximum temperature of 39.4 degree Celsius was recorded, the Met reports said on Wednesday. Churu remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 47 degree Celsius was recorded. It was believed that the Gujarat’s cyclone Vayu is responsible for the widespread rainfall activity in Rajasthan, however Jaipur Met office clearly refuted it. “It is a locally prevailed system and effect of upper air cyclonic circulation. The humidity level also increased up to 52% on Wednesday compared to 18% which was on Tuesday,” said Shiv Ganesh, director, Jaipur Met office. Due to the upper air cyclonic circulation and increased humidity levels many places in the state witnessed mild showers and dust storm during afternoon that guided mercury to take a dip. However the spell of rainfall was meagre as it worked as a catalyst to increase the humidity levels in the state as 52 percent humidity was reported in Jaipur and other parts of Rajasthan. However, due to Vayu cyclone that prevailed in Gujarat two trains were partially cancelled by the north western railways (NWR). “The trains including Bareilly-Bhuj and Bhuj-Bareilly would operate up to Abu Road station of Rajasthan only that means Bhuj-Bareily will start its journey from Abu Road to Bareilly and Bareilly-Bhuj would operate upto Abu Road only,” said a senior officer of NWR. People in Jaipur woke up to comparatively pleasant morning as a minimum temperature of 29.7 degree Celsius was recorded. In this season so far Jaipur had seen its minimum temperatures up to 33 degree Celsius. In the afternoon amidst the heavy cloud cover and drizzles maximum temperature of 42.8 degree Celsius was recorded which came as respite. Heavy dust storm and rainfall was witnessed in almost every parts of the state that also created some havoc. At many places electric poles got down while trees were also been uprooted. In many districts people already fighting with simmering heat conditions saw abrupt power cuts. In its forecast Jaipur met office said that mild showers and dust storm would be witnessed in the next 24 hours in eastern and western Rajasthan. Engineering stream likely to fill 50% se.description: JAIPUR: Engineering colleges are expecting to fill 50% seats in Rajasthan. Rajasthan Engineering Admission Process(REAP) are upbeat over the responses in the ongoing admission process. Last year, for around 40,000 seats, less than 15,000 applications were received. Till June 7, the body has received 7000 applications against the figure of 2000 last year in the first seven days of the admission process. As per experts, one of the reasons for less number of applicants last year was lower awareness among students regarding the examination and its benefits. This year, officials said that they have been promoting the examination by advertising on radio, television, newspapers and even sent officials to promote it within government school students. Sandeep Kumar, convener of the REAP, 2019 examination, said, “Last date of filling the form is June 29. Till June 7, we have already received 7,000 applications and the number is increasing every day. This is really a positive sign as last year by this date only 2,000 forms were received.” Due to the low turnout of students, government has been attempting various methods to attract more students. In 2017, one of the reasons for less number of applicants was the condition to deposit of advance amount of Rs 10,000 (refundable) along with the form fees of Rs 700. However, this was changed in 2018 and students were able to directly apply by depositing form fees. Earlier, exam was conducted for selection but now candidates are selected on the basis of JEE Mains and Advance rank An institute round is also conducted for any remaining seats where students can directly apply to the college of their choice. An official on condition of anonymity said that less number of students are opting for engineering because of low rate of placements in the field. “In Rajasthan, students opt for civil, electrical and mechanical engineering due to the scope available in government jobs. In other branches of engineering, placements are not as good as most companies prefer to hire engineers from Bangalore and there is no mechanism to hire graduates from Rajasthan colleges,” said the official. For mechanical engineering, equipment is costlier than other streams, hence, investment in infrastructure is poor. Punneet Sharma, an academician said that this year the trend is shifting and serious students are opting for Computer Science and Information technology due to the new developments in Artificial Intelligence. Rajasthan likely to witness monsoon by J.description: JAIPUR: Irrespective of the delay in the onset of monsoon in Kerala, the IMD said that its progress is satisfactory so far and it is expected to arrive in Rajasthan by June 22. Monsoon is expected to cover the entire state by July 1. Authorities said that increase in humidity, which has gone up to 75% from 18%, is also a good sign that makes things conducive for the onset of south west monsoon. Rajasthan in the past had witnessed monsoon rainfall on June 17 and June 20 in 2019 and 2018, respectively, and IMD said that the state can expect onset of monsoon by last week of June. By July first week, south west monsoon is likely to be widespread when state capital Jaipur can also expect the monsoon showers. After a prolonged spell of the heat wave conditions the upper air cyclonic circulation and northerly winds have also initiated mild showers and dust storm in almost every parts of the state. “For the onset of monsoon, the humidity plays the role of a catalyst.” Met office, Jaipur refuted the reports saying cyclone Vayu in Gujarat has deterred the south west monsoon winds. “Cyclones are regularly coming on and off to various regions but monsoon winds are strong enough to find their way. It has of course deviated the winds but not deterred them,” said an officer. The state badly needs a good monsoon since last year there was deficit rainfall in at least 14 districts. On Saturday many places in the state received mild showers and dust storm which guided the mercury to take a dip. However, Churu remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 45.8 degree Celsius was recorded. In Jaipur people woke up to a comparatively warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 31.4 degree Celsius was recorded. It was followed by drizzling afternoon as many places in the city witnessed scattered rainfall. A maximum temperature of 39 degree Celsius was recorded in the city. In its forecast Jaipur met office has forecast for mild showers at eastern and western parts of the state including the districts – Ajmer, Bharatpur, Banswara, Udaipur, Rajsamand, Sirohi, Jaipur, Jhunjhunu, Sikar, Sawai Madhopur and Dholpur districts. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Cops crack whip on \u2018dabba trading\u.description: UDAIPUR: In a major crackdown on hoax share trading, popularly known as ‘dabba karobar', Chittorgarh police have arrested four persons and seized sophisticated gadgets including laptops, mobile phones, computers and hard disk along with documents indicating transactions worth crores of rupees of shares buying and selling in the grey market. Police had been tipped of a hoax share trading company dealing in commodities and shares in Gandhi Nagar of Chittorgarh city. The operations were being done from a house behind magistrate colony. A team led by sadar SHO Navneet Bihari Vyas raided the house and found four operators handling the share transactions for their clients. The police found three computer monitors, CPUs, and two laptops that were linked with the online share market. The operators were receiving calls continuously and jotting down buying and selling of shares of various companies as per the directions of the clients, however, the purchase and sell was completely hoax and not the actual one as done by registered share brokers. Cops arrested Kusum Kant, Sachin Chouhan, Prateek Rao and Rahul Jain who told the police that they were mere salaried employees who worked for one Sandip Sethia. A case has been registered under section 420, 120-b of the IPC and various provisions under the Forward Contract Trading Regulation Act, IT Act etc. Probe revealed that Sethia has been operating a parallel stock exchange or dabba business wherein clients had been making huge investments in purchase and sale of enquity, commodity and agricultural derivatives. The transactions were not being punched on the real exchanges. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

At least 1,000 cattle feared dead in Chi.description: UDAIPUR: A large herd of cattle drowned when rainwater suddenly gushed in Gayari Kheda pond in Satpuda gram panchayat of Chittorgarh district on Tuesday midnight. Some 1,000 cattle were feared dead as they were swept away by water that gushed in suddenly in Gayari Kheda talaab. Chittorgarh received some eight inches rain in the past 24 hours that ended on Wednesday morning. The late hours showers created woes for people at many places who were stranded for hours at several places where roads were flooded with rainwater. Cattle being rescued in ChittorgarhSDM Vinod Kumar said that the rescued animals were being given medical care to save them from cold and excessive intake of water. The rescue operation continued till late evening where hundreds of carcasses were still lying in the pool of mud. According to sources, shepherd caravan had camped near Ghosunda dam area and the cattle herd was grazing which included more than 2,000 lambs and goats and two dozen camels. Heavy rains that lashed the area last night caused high inflow of water with dozens of animals being forcibly overtaken by tremendous amount of water. As the news spread, authorities including additional collector Mukesh Kumar, SDM Vinod Kumar and officials of the animal husbandry department rushed to the spot and rescue operation was started. Disaster handling teams from Hindustan Zinc and a cement company too conducted the rescue operation. Villagers and the rescue team brought out hundreds of animals safely. At 50.8 degrees Celsius, Churu logs high.description: JAIPUR: There was no respite from the blistering heat conditions in Rajasthan for the fifth consecutive day on Saturday. Breaking all records, Churu registered 50.8 degree Celsius, highest ever maximum temperature in the state on Saturday. Moreover, Jaipur Met office issued red alert for majority of the places in western Rajasthan and some parts of eastern Rajasthan for next five days. Last time, Churu saw its maximum temperature exceeding 50 degree Celsius was on May 19, 2016 when a maximum temperature of 50.2 degree Celsius was recorded. “Saturday’s maximum temperature of Churu was highest temperature ever registered by Jaipur Met office in any station,” said Shiv Ganesh, director, Jaipur Met office. In its forecast, Met office said that in western Rajasthan, the districts, including Jaisalmer, Barmer, Nagaur, Bikaner, Hanumangarh, Churu, Jodhpur, Barmer, Jalore and Pali will witness severe heatwave conditions till June 4. Likewise, in the eastern Rajasthan, the districts including Ajmer, Alwar, Bharatpur, Baran, Bundi, Dausa, Dholpur, Jaipur, Chittorgarh, Jhalawar, Jhunjhunu, Karauli, Kota, Sikar, Sawai Madhopur and Tonk will also witness severe heat conditions till Monday. People in Jaipur woke up to a warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 31.7 degree Celsius, almost four degree above the normal notch was recorded. It was followed by simmering afternoon when a maximum temperature of 45.2 degree Celsius was recorded. There has been a continuous rise in the number of patients complaining of vomiting, diarrhoea, heat stroke and sunburns. “Only thing advisable is that people should consume at least three litres of water daily, should avoid food outside and also apply god sunscreen while going out as ultra violet index is also high,” said a senior doctor at SMS hospital. In the afternoon, roads wore deserted look as people confined themselves to their respective offices and homes. Various eateries, restaurants and markets were almost empty till 6 pm at various parts of the state. Except Udaipur, majority of the places in the state witnessed its maximum temperatures above 44 degree Celsius. There is no forecast of any respite as similar conditions will prevail in the state till June 4. Except some dust storm and mild showers the weather would mainly remain dry in the state. Churu witnessed hottest day ever in its history as a maximum temperature of 50.8 degree Celsius was recorded. In Video:Heatwave conditions peak across India, 2 dead as temperature crosses 50 in Rajasthan’s ChuruDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Five arrested in Udaipur bride kidnappin.description: UDAIPUR: Five persons were arrested after a bride in Udaipur was allegedly abducted on her way to her groom’s house. Bride Vinita Suthar, who was rescued by the police on Wednesday, expressed her desire to go with her husband while the accused and his four aides are in police custody. Udaipur police had rescued the bride from a private bus in Sindhi Camp in Jaipur in the wee hours of Wednesday. They were brought to Udaipur later in the day. Vineeta in her statement to the police said that she was abducted against her wishes by Priyank and his friends. In explanation to a letter that had gone viral on social media, the bride said it was written about two months ago when she had planned to elope with Priyank. However after persuasion and counselling by family members, she had changed her mind, and agreed to get married to Kshitij on Monday. On the bride's statement police arrested 27-year old Priyank Jeengar, his friends Puneet Nagda (24), Harish Patel (21) all residents of Savina, Udaipur, Vijay Singh (20) and UdaiSingh both residents of Chittorgarh district. The five accused have been arrested on charges of physical assault, abduction, robbery and conspiracy under sections 307,365,395 and 120(b) of the IPC. The bride said she was taken to Chittorgarh in the car and from there the youths took another car for Bhilwara. From there Vinita and Priyank got into a private travel bus for Jaipur. However, Police tracked their location and instructed the bus driver not to stop the bus anywhere and take it straight to Jaipur where the couple were held around 3am. Udaipur SP Kailash Chandra Vishnoi, said, “Prima Facie Vineeta’s statement that she was abducted goes against Priyank and his friends. Vineeta's husband Kshitij has mentioned in the complaint that the bride was wearing 35 tola gold at the time she was forcibly taken away. Vineeta also stated that the letter wherein she had written of going away with Priyank was two months old and after that she changed her mind.” Police are yet to get hold of the hard copy of the letter which was made viral on social media by one of Priyank's friends. Bride\u2019s letter exposes abduction st.description: UDAIPUR: By late Tuesday night, the bride abduction incident in Udaipur turned out to be yet another case of love affair where the girl had conspired with her lover to elope from a forced marriage. According to sources, the bride Vinita was in love with accused Priyank who hailed from a different caste. Her family stood against their union and hence had fixed her marriage with Kshitij. Police found a letter written by Vinita who confessed her intense love for Priyank and said that she was going away with him as they could not live without each other. In the letter, the bride wrote that she was in touch with Priyank whom she had known for 13 years. He tried to convince her parents but in vain as her family didn't accept their love and gave more value to societal values and honour. “Had you realized our love you would not have forced me to marry Kshitij but I cannot live without Priyank and hence do not search for us,” the letter read. The bride also urged her parents not to create any trouble for Priyank’s family. Earlier, on Tuesday morning when a bride who was on her way to in-laws home after vidai ceremony, was forcedly taken away by some men in a car. The assailants damaged the bride's car, thrashed the groom severely before fleeing with the bride. Special police teams comprising of all SHOs of city police stations is on lookout for the abductors and the bride while community people from the girls side held massive protest at the crime scene and police station demanding an immediate arrest of the accused. The bride's family has expressed suspicion on a youth from the neighborhood to be behind the kidnap. Police had a hard time pacifying community men from the accused's side who stood in the way of the police while taking the accused's family to police station for interrogation. "Special teams have been made to find the accused and bride. CCTV footage have been sought and alerts have been raised at toll plazas. Some people have been interrogated and we will find the kidnappers soon" additional SP, city Gopal Swaroop Mewara said. Police didn't rule out a love angle in the case as that had been in the Sikar incident. The groom Kshitij Sharma, a resident of Chintaman Ghati of Bhattiyani Chohhatta area had tied the nuptial with the bride, a resident of Titardi under Savina police station limit. The rituals were performed on Monday late night and hence vidai was held early morning. Around 6 am the bride has set off with her husband in his car while other relatives were following in other cars. Near a railway crossing, a white car stopped before their car and few men barged out and laid an attack. They damaged the glass and thrashed the groom. They fled with the bride. People from the bride and groom's side gathered at the news spread and police had to face severe anger. The bride's family named a youth from their neighbourhood to be involved in the kidnapping who was from another caste. Police went to search the house of the accused where they couldn't find him and hence as they were ready to take his family to police station, their community people protested sharply. Heatwave unabated in Rajasthan; Sriganga.description: JAIPUR: Heatwave conditions continued to prevail in Rajasthan for the third consecutive day on Thursday. Sriganganagar witnessed the hottest day of the season with temperatures rising to 48 degree Celsius. Jaipur recorded 32.2 degree Celsius, almost 5 degrees above the normal notch. It was followed by a simmering afternoon as the maximum temperature was recorded at 45.2 degree Celsius. In the past three days, the footfall of the patients complaining of heat stroke, diarrhoea and even food poisoning have increased. Doctors are advising patients to increase the intake of water having some salt and sugar in it in order to stay hydrated. In the afternoon roads wore an empty look as people confined themselves to their respective homes and offices. In the evening people thronged at juice corners and refreshed themselves with chilled beverages. The continued rise in the mercury also increased the work of the technicians of the Jaipur Vidyut Vitaran Nigam Limited(JVVNL). “Since Wednesday evening to Thursday morning, we have attended almost 100 calls of abrupt power cuts in various localities. Due to extra load electricity tripped,” said an officer. Many people were going through various apps on their phones to check the weather conditions. “Even at 10.30am the maximum temperature in Jaipur was 44 degree Celsius as per the details through various apps giving,” said Manoj Tanwani who was returning after a walk at Central Park in Jaipur. Sriganganagar was followed by Churu where the maximum temperature was recorded at 47.7 degree Celsius, Bikaner - 47.0, Jaisalmer - 45.7, Kota - 45.4, Jodhpur - 44.6, Barmer - 44, Ajmer 43.8 and 42.8 degree Celsius in Udaipur. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave continues in Rajasthan, laboure.description: JAIPUR/KOTA: Scorching heat claimed the life of a 45-year-old MNREGA labourer at Kheyawada village under Budhadeet police station in Kota district on Saturday. While temperatures soared across the state, Sawai Madhopur was the hottest with a maximum temperature of 43.7 degrees Celsius. The deceased, identified as Shanti Lal Meena, fainted at 10am while working in a MNREGA muster roll in Kheyawada village. He was rushed to the hospital where he was declared brought dead. The Kota region is experiencing extreme heat with maximum temperature settling at 43.3 degrees Celsius and minimum at 27.2 degrees Celsius on Saturday. Meanwhile, Jaipur city logged a maximum temperature of 41.4 degrees Celsius. Mild dust storm was witnessed in the evening. Jaipur Met office has predicted high-velocity dust storm at many places in the state, and light rain in some parts, in the next 24 hours. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

At 33.1\u00b0C, Jaipur logs warmest morn.description: JAIPUR: The state remained under the grip of severe heatwave conditions for the fourth consecutive day on Friday with majority of places witnessing maximum temperatures of above 44 degree Celsius. Sriganganagar witnessed the hottest day of the season so far, reporting a maximum temperature of 49.6 degree Celsius. Jaipur witnessed the warmest morning of the season so far, recording a minimum temperature of 33.1 degree Celsius. Attributing the continued rise in the temperatures to northerly winds, Jaipur Met office said that the absence of any weather systems, including upper air cyclonic circulation and western disturbances, the heatwave conditions will further aggravate in the western Rajasthan. However, the rest of the state may witness a minor respite. In Jaipur, people woke up to the warmest morning of the season as the city recorded a minimum temperature of 33.1 degree Celsius. Since Thursday evening, the technicians of Jaipur Vidyut Vitaran Nigam Limited (JVVNL) were receiving phone calls on power failures that have continued till Friday morning. “Excess load has been the reason for continued tripping. Whereever problems occurred, our team rushed and rectified it,” said an engineer of the JVVNL to TOI. The continued rise in mercury has also increased the water crisis in the city. Many colonies are getting water supplied from tankers. In the afternoon, a maximum temperature rose to 44.2 degree Celsius. Though cloudy conditions prevailed across the city, there was no rainfall. In the evening, the mobile phone apps providing weather details were showing a minimum temperature above 30 degree Celsius. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

At 47.3 degrees, Churu hottest in Rajast.description: JAIPUR: People in the state witnessed simmering heatwave conditions when continued rise in the temperatures was witnessed. Many places witnessed its maximum temperatures or and above 45 degrees Celsius. Jaipur registered 44.5 degrees Celsius, season’s highest temperature on Wednesday along with a minimum temperature of 30.2 degrees Celsius, season’s warmest morning on Wednesday. Churu remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 47.3 degrees Celsius was recorded.  As the heat wave conditions gripped the state majority of the trains and buses during afternoon hours were empty while the roads across the state wore deserted look in the afternoon. Many districts in the state already struggling with the water crisis were also been affected with the severe heat wave conditions. Attributing the continued rise in the mercury to the active northerly winds Jaipur met office said that similar conditions would be witnessed in the state for the coming days. Temperatures are likely to show a rising trend for the next six days. In Jaipur people experienced the warmest morning of the season along with the hottest day of the season so far. The temperatures here were at least 4 degrees above the normal notch. In the afternoon be it were city roads, the city buses or the eateries on the roads everything was empty and quiet. People confined themselves to their respective homes and offices. Hospitals in Jaipur also saw a sudden rise of patients complaining of heat strokes, diarrhoea and urine infection. “During this kind of spell, it is better to drink at least 3 litre of water every day. One should keep himself filled with fluids,” said a senior doctor at the SMS Hospital. Churu was followed by Sriganganagar and Bikaner where a maximum temperature of 46.8 degree Celsius was recorded, Jaisalmer 45.5, Kota 45.3, Barmer 45.2, Ajmer 44.0 and in Udaipur a maximum temperature of 41.6 degree Celsius was recorded. In its forecast Jaipur met office said that heat wave conditions will further aggravate in the state in the next 24 hours. Many places in the state will witness its maximum temperatures on or above 45 degrees Celsius. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Here is a list of contituencies with prominent candiadates or clashes. Sriganganagar hottest in Rajasthan at 48.description: JAIPUR: Heatwave conditions further aggravated in the state on Sunday when majority of the places witnessed maximum temperature on or above 45 degree Celsius except Udaipur where a maximum temperature of 44.4 degree Celsius was recorded. Sriganganagar remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 48.5 degree Celsius was recorded, the Met reports said. Three people including a middle-aged died of suspected heatstroke on Sunday at Abu Road (Sirohi), Kota and Pali districts of the state. A woman travelling in a train complained of nausea and vomiting when the train reached Abu Road. She was rushed to a hospital where she was declared brought dead, according to the police. Similarly, a person identified as Gajanand Koli travelling on a bike to Sangod died of suspected heat stroke in Kota district. In another incident a youth working in his shop at Raipur town of Pali was found dead. Locals suspected it to be a heat stroke-related death. Attributing the revival of the heatwave conditions Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state in the next couple of days. However, some places in the state are likely to witness pre-monsoon showers. Jaipurites woke up to a comparatively warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 31.2 degree Celsius was recorded in the city. Though cloudy conditions prevailed in the city, a maximum temperature of 45.8 degree Celsius was recorded, almost 5 degrees above the normal notch. In this season so far this has been the highest temperature in the Pink City . Due to the increase in the temperature the roads were empty in the afternoon as people confined themselves to their homes because of heat and holiday. Many colonies in the city also witnessed abrupt power cuts while various areas in the Walled City have been facing water crisis. Apart from Jaipur heatwave was witnessed in almost every part of the state. People are using ice in their water coolers and tankers to beat the heat. Many cities including Churu, Sriganganagar, Bikaner, Barmer and Jaisalmer witnessed no activity during afternoon. It has been a prolonged heatwave spell which has continued for the past 12 days in Rajasthan. In its forecast Jaipur met office said that severe to very severe heat wave conditions would be witnessed in the eastern and western parts of the state in the next 24 hours. A few places in the state are likely to get high-velocity winds and thundershowers which may bring the elusive respite from the prolonged spell of the heatwave conditions. Dungarpur cops raise funds for orphan gi.description: UDAIPUR: Acting as good samaritans, the staff of Chitri police station in Dungarpur district contributed money from their pockets and arranged the wedding ceremony of an orphan tribal girl Sushila Damor, in Nainvasa village on Friday. SHO Ajay Singh Rao and his wife, assumed the role of the bride’s parents and performed the ‘kanyadaan’. The entire staff attended the wedding and blessed the couple. Chatura and Pemli Damor, Sushila's parents had eight daughters in all. Three of them were already married when Chatura passed away of some prolonged illness five years ago. Their mother, Pemli did odd jobs to support the family, but she too died two years back, leaving her five daughters to fend for themselves. Their paternal uncle Bachulal took care of his nieces and sent two younger ones to school while the three grown-up girls worked in fields and did other menial jobs to support their uncle. “Some villagers who had come to the police station happened to casually mention about the plight of these girls and said that Bachulal had found a groom for Sushila but he was unable to bear the wedding expenses. This moved our hearts and we decided to raise money for a noble cause. Every staff member contributed on his/her free will as per their capacity and we had enough to arrange for a decent wedding and to gift household items to the couple to start their new life,” the SHO told TOI. The arrangement for the wedding feast was also taken care of by the cops. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Minor raped in Udaipur, 4 held.description: UDAIPUR: A minor was arrested on Wednesday for raping a 15-year-old girl in Pratapnagar area of the city.  Police have arrested three other youths for allegedly making a video of them in a compromising position and spreading it on social media. Additional SP Gopal Swaroop Mewara said the girl knew the accused who took her to a deserted spot and raped her on Tuesday. Three youths who happened to be there made clips of them. The minor rape accused has been arrested under the POCSO Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rs 350-crore flyovers to unclog Jaipur-K.description: JAIPUR: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) will undertake a Rs 350-crore project to unclog the Jaipur-Kishangarh stretch. The authority has decided to construct flyovers on the route including Mahapura, Bhankrota, Mahindra SEZ, Mehla, Kamla Nehru Nagar and Bandar Sindri. “Bids will be invited after the model code of conduct is lifted. The Central ministry has given approval for the project. The actual cost of the project will be ascertained after the detailed project report (DPR). As per the initial project report, Rs 350 crore will be spent on the entire project,” said an official. The project is expected to solve the perennial traffic problem at Bhankrota and Mahapura junction which have become a part of the city after expansion. The absence of a flyover on these points leaves the traffic in knots. The faulty planning of NHAI on NH-8 (Jaipur-Ajmer) is allegedly giving sleepless nights to the traffic department. In a traffic control board (TCB) meetings, the traffic department has strongly urged the Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) to construct a flyover at Mahapura and Bhankrota crossroads several times. “At Kamla Nehru Nagar, the flyover was constructed at one end. As per the requirement, the structure will be built at both ends to provide swift passage,” added the official. An official source at Jaipur police said, “The JDA had assured to draw a plan to reduce traffic congestion in the area. However, the plight of drivers and motorists passing through the choked stretches of NH-8 did not come to an end as the civic body expressed helplessness in constructing flyover over these stretches because the area comes under NHAI jurisdiction.” The Jaipur-Ajmer highway is the main national highway which connects Udaipur, Mumbai, and Ahmedabad. Thus, the traffic load is too high on the highway. After the city expanded during the last few years, many colonies sprung up on NH-8 resulting in heavy traffic. Commuters have expressed the necessity of a flyover in the area as the stretch is choked due to heavy vehicles including trucks. Moreover, frequent accidents near Mahapura have raised concerns of the traffic department. “The JDA periphery ends at C-zone bypass. The problem is certainly mounting due to faulty planning of NHAI. The authority should have constructed a flyover over this stretch as it passes through urban areas,” said a senior engineer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Heatwave conditions aggravate in Rajasth.description: JAIPUR: Severe heatwave conditions were witnessed in the state on Thursday with majority of the places witnessing a rise in temperatures. The average maximum temperature of 41.0 degree Celsius was recorded across the state. Jaipur met office further stated that there will be dust storms, accompanied with thunderstorm in some parts of the state, while the heatwave conditions will prevail in the western and eastern parts of the state. Sawai Madhopur and Churu remained the hottest in the state, where a maximum temperature of 44.5 degree Celsius each was recorded. Attributing the change in weather to the active western disturbances, Jaipur met office said that some relief would be witnessed in some parts of the state. Dust storm and thundershowers would be witnessed in some parts of northern and southern Rajasthan. People in Jaipur witnessed the hottest morning and day of the season so far, as minimum and maximum temperatures of 29.0 and 42.0 degree Celsius respectively were recorded. Sawai Madhopur and Churu were followed by Kota, where a maximum temperature of 43.0 degree Celsius was recorded, Jodhpur 42.4, Bikaner 41.6, Udaipur 41.2, Barmer 41.1, Ajmer 41.0, Jaisalmer 40.5 and a maximum temperature of 34.0 degree Celsius was recorded in Sriganganagar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors\u2019 strike: No OPD services in.description: JAIPUR/UDAIPUR/AJMER/KOTA: Health services remained crippled in the state as government and private doctors went on a 24-hour strike from 6am on Monday in support of Indian Medical Association (IMA)’s call for nationwide medical bandh. There are 40,000 doctors in the state, working in government and private hospitals. “No OPD services were provided by doctors in the 2,900 government hospitals and health centres. Only emergency services were available. However, doctors conducted post-mortems,” said Dr Ajay Chaudhary, president, All Rajasthan In-Service Doctors Association (ARISDA), a body of doctors posted in rural areas and district hospitals. Health minister Raghu Sharma said, “We have deployed AYUSH doctors practicing Ayurveda, Unani, Homoeopathy in district hospitals along with nursing staff to take care of the patients as an alternative measure.” However, the alternative measures failed to provide much relief to the patients. In Ajmer’s JLN Hospital, patients had to wait for their turn in serpentine queue of patients for registration. But there was no doctor in the OPD. No operation was conducted in the hospital and even patients going to different government hospitals were forced to come to JLN Hospital. At least six serious patients had to be rushed to Jaipur’s SMS hospital from Ajmer’s JLN Hospital for treatment. In JLN Hospital there was long queue of patients early Monday morning where patients got the receipt but there was no doctor in the OPD. The senior doctors came out to help the crowd but it took hours for patients to get their turn. Besides Ajemer, medical and health services were also badly hit in Udaipur division as doctors refrained from duties. Hundreds of patients during the OPD hours had to leave without any treatment as 350 resident and senior doctors were not on duty at the government MB Hospital here in Udaipur. The doctors took out a rally from the hospital campus to the collectorate raising slogans against increasing attacks on the medical practitioners. However, surgeries had to be postponed for the day. Doctors tied bandage on their foreheads and protested against the Bengal incident in the state. At Chittorgarh, delivery operation cases and major surgeries were badly affected and only those patients requiring immediate medical care were taken in. Emergency OPD functioned with the help of the nursing staff while 56 doctors posted at the district hospital remained on strike. The OPD services in hospitals in Kota region witnessed medical care of indoor patients, emergency unit in hospitals attached to New Medical College hospital in Kota continued without any disturbance and the surgeries upon serious patients were also conducted. However, 2,200 doctors attached with ARISDA and IMA had been on strike in hospitals across Hadouti region comprising Kota, Bundi and Jhalawar district. The medical and health services in OPD as well as in indoor, emergency wards continued undisturbed in Maharao Bheem Singh (MBS) Hospital in Kota, said Dr Naveen Saxena, superintendent, MBS Hospital. Faculties took the charge of OPD in MBS Hospital while nine out of 14 surgeries were conducted here. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Moderate showers in Rajasthan continue t.description: JAIPUR: Mild to moderate showers continued in the state for the fifth consecutive day on Monday and provided relief. Widespread rainfall activity was witnessed at many places in the state and the Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state in the next couple of days. Kota remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 40.9 degree Celsius was recorded. By and large the weather remained pleasant in the state. People in Churu also witnessed pleasant morning and afternoon after witnessing mercury reaching on and above 50 degree Celsius at least three times in this season so far. Attributing the climatic conditions to the active northerly winds and upper air cyclonic circulation Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state in the next couple of days. Rising humidity levels is a good sign and would work as a catalyst for the onset of monsoon in the state, said experts. A pleasant morning was witnessed in Jaipur as a minimum temperature of 27.8 degree Celsius was recorded. Also, rainfall of 11 mm provided relief to the people in the city from simmering hot conditions. In the afternoon amidst clouds a maximum temperature of 37.4, almost 4 degrees below the normal notch was recorded. In the evening people rushed to various hang-out joints to enjoy the pleasant weather. Many places in the state witnessed mild to moderate showers including Lakshmangarh (Sikar) and Gogunda (Udaipur) where a rainfall of 50 mm was received. It was followed by Sikrai (Dausa) and Nawalgarh (Jhunjhunu) where 40 mm rainfall was recorded. Likewise, many places in the eastern and western parts of the state also witnessed a rainfall ranging from 40 mm to 10 mm. In its forecast Jaipur Met office said that mild to moderate showers will continue in the eastern and western Rajasthan for next couple of days. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Udaipur landfill site set for big green.description: UDAIPUR: The huge mound of garbage at the Titardi landfill, 10 km from the city, would no longer exist. The Udaipur Smart City Limited and the Udaipur Municipal Corporation (UMC) has embarked on a project to replace the heap of smelly rubbish with a green cover. The cost of the project is pegged at Rs 4.96 crore and expected to be completed by May 27, 2019. “We are working for the scientific closure of Titardi landfill site by partly moving the garbage and reorganizing it. Major work for compaction of garbage in multiple layers have been done and soon the site would be replaced by a green cover with orchards and trees for the public to have a breathing space,” CEO, zila parishad, Quamar Choudhary, who is supervising the project told TOI. The municipal corporation generates about 150 tonne garbage per day. Presently, UMC does not have proper treatment and disposal facility. The total waste generated in Udaipur has been dumped at Titardi dumping ground. The dumping ground has a history of about 40 years and had almost reached the verge of spillover. Dumping was stopped after public protests in 2013. It is estimated that about 83,700 cum of garbage was dumped during this phase. The Titardi open solid waste dumpsite was posing a threat to the environment and human health. It is proposed to reorganize the haphazardly dumped old garbage in layers and a final closure would be done. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave continues, Met says \u2018mercu.description: JAIPUR: Heatwave conditions further aggravated in the state on Monday when majority of places witnessed maximum temperature of 41 degree Celsius and above. There was also a rise in the minimum temperature which was almost 4 degrees above the normal notch. Churu remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 45 degree Celsius was recorded, the Met reports said. Attributing the continued rise in mercury to the active northerly winds and vanishing of upper air cyclonic circulation and westerly winds, the Jaipur Met office said that the mercury will continue to take an upward swing in the state in the next couple of days. Jaipurites woke up to a comparatively warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 29.5 degree Celsius, almost 2 degrees above the normal notch was recorded. It was followed by a sultry afternoon as a maximum temperature of 42 degree Celsius accompanied with 55 per cent humidity was witnessed.  Churu was followed by Bikaner where a maximum temperature of 44.9 degree Celsius was recorded, Kota 44.7, Jaisalmer 44.2, Barmer 44.1, Jodhpur 43.6, Sriganganagar 43.5, Ajmer 42.9 and 41.4 degree Celsius in Udaipur. In its forecast, Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state for the next couple of days. Heatwave conditions will further aggravate in the next 24 hours. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Chittor woman alleges harassment by cops.description: UDAIPUR: A 32-year-old woman appeared before the district magistrate on Monday seeking euthanasia for self and her two kids in Chittorgarh. Pushpa, wife of Narayan Gurjar and a resident of Rawatbhata block has given a written application to the collector asking for mercy killing. The reason she stated was that the local police and goons were acting on the behlaf of legislator Rajendra Vidhuri and are harassing her family for political reasons. Pushpa's husband Narayan is accused in a case of stone pelting and damaging vehicle belonging to the municipal council chairman Dharmendra Tilani. Narayan has been absconding since the incident. Pushpa said that on May 30 some policemen came to her house and forcibly took her to the police station around 2pm. She was harassed, beaten and tortured in the presence of officers of ASP and deputy SP ranks. She was let off only after 8pm when her family came looking for her. Pushpa told the media that the police have seized her mobile. The woman said that neither she nor her husband had any connection with politics but since he refused to campaign for Vidhuri and participated in his opponent's rallies, the legislator is bent upon making their lives hell. She accused the local police acting like pawns in the hands of the legislator and unnecessarily harassing the family. She sought permission for mercy killing for self, her 6-year-old son and an 8-year-old daughter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Udaipur: Constable\u2019s wife alleges r.description: UDAIPUR: A police constable’s wife has lodged an FIR alleging blackmail, robbery and rape charges on one of her acquaintances. The woman said in her complaint that she met Suresh Bhagora, a resident of Bhudhar under Kesariya ji police station in Udaipur, two years ago while she was enrolled in a coaching centre for general nursing course in Kherwada. The accused too was receiving coaching from the institute. She alleged that Bhagora clicked some objectionable pictures of her and continued to make phone calls despite her disapproval. He demanded money for not showing the pictures to her family but when she refused he snatched her debit card, the complaint says. The rape survivor told the police that the accused withdrew Rs 40,000 from her bank account. On May 7, he came to the police line gate, called her and said that he would return the debit card if she went along with him. The complainant said that she accompanied the accused to get back her card, which the accused said was at one of his relative’s home in Kherwada. The accused sexually abused her there and even snatched her gold chain. A report under Sections 363, 376, 354 and 384 has been registered and a police team has been sent to Udaipur to arrest the accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Undertrial jail inmate dies, kin seeks p.description: UDAIPUR: Death of an undertrial prisoner in Sagwara sub-jail in Dungarpur district created tension between the jail authorities and the deceased's family. Kanhaiya Lal, a resident of Bhudhar village in Udaipur, was in Sagwara jail in connection to a chain snatching case since April 10. His health failed and was hospitalized after he vomited blood on May 5. However he died in the hospital on Tuesday morning. The Kotwali police shifted his body to mortuary while his family refused to agree that it had been a natural death. They claimed it to be a murder and demanded a probe in a letter to the IG, Udaipur. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rain, dust storm bring some respite from.description: JAIPUR: Moderate rainfall and dust storm provided the elusive relief to the state reeling under severe heat wave conditions for the past fortnight. A drop of almost five degrees Celsius on an average was reported across the state on Thursday. However, Churu and Sriganganagar were the hottest places with a maximum temperature of 44.5 degrees Celsius. Attributing the rainfall and dust storm to the active northerly winds and upper air cyclonic circulation, the Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will continue in the state for the next couple of days. The ongoing rain spell in the state has also become a catalyst for the increased humidity levels which are conducive for monsoon rain. People in Jaipur witnessed a warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 28.2 degrees Celsius was recorded in the city. It was followed by a cloudy and pleasant afternoon as a maximum temperature of 36.3 degrees Celsius was recorded. For the first time in the season, the city recorded maximum temperature below 40 degrees. Farmers in the city outskirts were elated as rainfall prior to the monsoon is always considered a blessing for sowing seeds. Some places in the city witnessed scattered rainfall which also guided the mercury to take a dip. The ongoing rain spell has increased the humidity upto 72 percent. The Jaipur Met office, however, denied that the spell was related to cyclone Vayu. Many places in the state received rainfall varying from 70mm to 10mm. Mount Abu (Sirohi) received 70 mm rain, the highest in the state on Thursday. Churu and Sriganganagar were followed by Bikaner where a maximum temperature of 43.1 degrees Celsius was recorded, Jaisalmer 41.2, Kota 39.5, Barmer 38.9, Jodhpur 37.6, Jaipur 36.3, Udaipur 34.5 and a maximum temperature of 33 degrees Celsius was recorded in Ajmer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

H1B Visa news.description: WASHINGTON: The Trump administration has no plans to cap H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally, the state department said on Thursday. Reuters reported on Wednesday that the United States had told India it was considering restricting the H-1B visa programmes for countries with the data storage requirement. The H-1B programme issues US visas to skilled foreign workers. US mulling 15% cap on H-1B visa for Indians"The Trump Administration has no plans to place caps on H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally," a state department spokeswoman said in a statement in response to the Reuters article. While an administration's "Buy American Hire American" executive order calls for a broad review of US worker visa programs, including the H-1B programme, it was not targeted at a specific country, the spokeswoman said. It is "completely separate from our ongoing discussions with India about the importance of ensuring the free flow of data across borders," the spokeswoman added. Earlier on Thursday, India said it was in talks with the United States on H-1B visas, but foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar told a news conference: "We have not heard anything officially from the US government" on capping such permits for Indians. US secretary of state Mike Pompeo is scheduled to visit New Delhi next week for talks that will include areas of disagreement between the two countries over trade. H-1B cap for India? It’s not easy and may need approval by US Congress, say expertsTwo senior Indian officials told Reuters on Wednesday they had been briefed last week on a US plan to cap the number of H-1B visas given annually to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the total number issued. There is no country-specific limit on the 85,000 H-1B work visas the United States issues every year, and an estimated 70% of them go to Indians.
