Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. In Video:Several killed as bus falls into gorge in Himachal Pradesh's KulluDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Cyclone Fani not likely to hit Rajasthan.description: JAIPUR: The Jaipur Met office on Friday said that cyclone Fani which will affect weather conditions in Tamil Nadu and other nearby states is not going to affect Rajasthan. However, dust storm, rainfall and hailstorm is likely to occur at a few places in the state due to the local phenomenon. Heat wave conditions continued across the state while some places witnessed moderate dust storm. Churu remained hottest in the state where a maximum temperature of 44.5 degrees Celsius. Heavy rainfall is expected in Tamil Nadu, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh and some parts of Kerala due to the impact of the cyclone Fani in the next couple of days. "Rajasthan is not going to witness any impact due to this cyclone. However, cloudy conditions will prevail and some parts of western and eastern parts likely to get mild showers due to locally prevailing system," said Shiv Ganesh, director, Jaipur Met office. He added that the cyclone which is already intimidating some parts of the country is not going to impact the state. Meanwhile, weather continued to remain dry in the state. Mild velocity dust storm was also witnessed in some parts of the state. Churu was followed by Kota where a maximum temperature of 43.5 degrees Celsius was recorded, Barmer 43, Jaisalmer 42.9, Churu 42.7, Jodhpur and Bikaner 42.5 degrees Celsius each was recorded, Sriganganagar 41.5 degrees and a maximum temperature of 41.4 degrees was recorded in Udaipur. Jaipurities woke up to a lesser warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 28.3 degrees Celsius was recorded. It was followed by dusty and cloudy afternoon, however, no rainfall took place. The mild dust storm only brought abrupt power cuts in some parts of the city. In its forecast Jaipur met office said that mild showers will occur at some places in the eastern and western Rajasthan, however weather would mainly remain dry in rest of the state in the next 24 hours. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan: Crimes against women increase.description: JAIPUR: In the first four months of 2019, crimes against women in Rajasthan under all IPC sections jumped by 40.56 per cent compared to the same period last year. Offences under other major IPC sections also increased by over 13 per cent. The state over the past few months has witnessed heinous incidents of rape, brazen shootouts, clashes and loots. The new regime is facing backlash for the lawlessness and disorder spreading on the state’s streets. From January to April this year, the Rajasthan police registered total 62,666 IPC offences including murder, attempt to murder, loot, rape, abduction, theft etc. Compared to 55,102 cases registered last year during the same period, there is a clear increase of 13.73 per cent in serious offences. The serious offences like murder, attempt to murder, loot, burglary and theft have also shot up in the state. With the CM Ashok Gehlot holding the home portfolio, the rising crime graph doesn’t augur well for the new dispensation. While the Rajasthan police have attributed easy registration of crime behind the steep increase in crime rates, the spurt in rape cases paints a sorry picture of the state. For past four months, crimes against women have been rising steadily, showing an unprecedented increase of 40.56 per cent. Between January to April in 2018, the Rajasthan police registered 7,764 cases of crimes against women. For the same period of time in 2019 the number of cases filed was 10,913. The Rajasthan police’s crime records show that it registered 1,509 rape cases in 2019, compared to 1,312 in previous year’s initial four months. The increase of 15.02 indicate how unsafe the state continued to be for the women despite several officials claiming that many rape cases culminate in FRs (final reports) as they are false and filed with a sole aim for petty gains. Another shameful topic in Rajasthan police’s list include rampant incidents of women being abducted and kidnapped. The figures reveal that in 2019, total 1,706 women were abducted, a horrifying increase of over 20 percent from 1,415 cases that were reported in 2018. Meanwhile, a senior official said that many of these rape cases turned out to be fasle. “We have made sustained efforts to ensure that all FIRs are registered. We have time and again directed to all SHOs that FIRs should be filed, our concern is that all cases should be probed. The crime graph has increased because registration of crime has become easy,” said the official. Leader of opposition and former BJP home minister, Gulab Chand Kataira told TOI that the increase in the crime is failure of law and order machinery. “During BJP government rule, I used to sit down with the senior police officials and analyse each district individually. A monthly ranking from SHO to SP was conducted,” he said, adding that CM Gehlot has not been able to monitor or supervise the police due to which the crime has increased by leaps and bounds. “Even in major cities of the state like Jaipur and Jodhpur, the crime rate is at an alarmingly high level,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave hits life in parts of Rajasthan.description: JAIPUR: Blistering heat wave affected normal life in parts of Rajasthan where Bikaner recorded the highest temperature of 45.6 degrees Celsius on Tuesday. Jaipur Met office has said the heat wave conditions would intensify in eastern and western parts of the state in the next couple of days. Continued rise in mercury has further aggravated problems related to drinking water and power supply. In some parts of the state including Barmer, Ajmer, Bhilwara, Jodhpur, Churu, Bikaner and Jaisalmer, people are not getting drinking water on a regular basis. The district collectors concerned are arranging for water tankers for the public. In Jaipur, a minimum of 29.6 degrees Celsius was recorded, almost two degrees above normal. The city witnessed the hottest day of the season so far with maximum temperature of 43.2 degrees Celsius. Several colonies also witnessed abrupt power cuts due to increased usage in city. Bikaner was followed by Sriganganagar and Jaisalmer where a maximum temperature of 45.2 degrees Celsius was recorded, Churu 45.1, Kota 45 Barmer 44.6, Jodhpur 44.5, Ajmer 43.5 and a maximum of 41.8 degrees Celsius was recorded in Udaipur. The heat wave conditions will further aggravate in the state in the next 24 hours, Jaipur Met office said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Minor raped in Udaipur, four held.description: UDAIPUR: A minor was arrested on Wednesday for raping a 15-year-old girl in Pratapnagar area of the city. Police have arrested three other youths for allegedly making a video of them in a compromising position and spreading it on social media. Additional SP Gopal Swaroop Mewara said the girl knew the accused who took her to a deserted spot and raped her on Tuesday. Three youths who happened to be there made clips of them. The minor rape accused has been arrested under the POCSO Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati. Want to stay with my parents, kidnapped.description: UDAIPUR: The twist and drama continued to surround the bride abduction case on the third day on Thursday. The bride Vinita Suthar, who was produced before a local court here, said in her statement before the magistrate that she does not want to go to her husband's house and be allowed to go back to her parents’ house. A day earlier, when the police had brought back Vinita and Priyank to Udaipur from Jaipur, the bride got emotional on seeing her newly-wed husband in an injured state and hugged him at the police station. She then told the police that she wished to live with her husband. However, she changed her statement before the magistrate on Thursday. The police produced the accused Priyank Jeengar and his four friends before the court and sought three days police remand. “The court has sent Vinita to Nari Niketan for the time being while the accused would be in police custody till May 11,” Hanuwant Singh Rajpurohit, SHO of Hiran Magri police station said. The accused would be taken to the crime spot and all the places where they had taken Vinita after abduction, said police. Police are yet to find the weapons and sticks that were used in abduction. Vinita in her statement to the police a day ago had claimed that Priyank had taken her away against her wish and that he had emotionally blackmailed her to accompany him.
